body_html:
You must install Eigen and link to it properly. I ran into a similar issue until I installed Eigen.
…
On Wed, May 24, 2017 at 3:26 AM Sean Aubin ***@***.***> wrote: Despite the advice of @lababidi <https://github.com/lababidi>, the following command: g++ -std=c++11 -o tf_basic \ -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/ \ -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/bazel-genfiles/ \ -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/third_party/ \ -g -Wall -D_DEBUG -Wshadow -Wno-sign-compare -w \ -L /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/bazel-bin/tensorflow/ \ `pkg-config --cflags --libs protobuf` -l tensorflow_cc basic.cc To compile: #include <tensorflow/core/public/session.h> #include <tensorflow/core/platform/env.h> #include <iostream> #include <chrono> #include <fstream> #include <string> #include <vector> #include <sstream> using namespace std; using namespace chrono; using namespace tensorflow; int main(int argc, char* argv[]) { // Initialize a tensorflow session cout << "start initalize session" << "\n"; Session* session; Status status = NewSession(SessionOptions(), &session); if (!status.ok()) { cout << status.ToString() << "\n"; return 1; } } But this gives me the error: In file included from /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/tensor.h:19:0, from /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/public/session.h:23, from basic.cc:1: /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor:1:42: fatal error: unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor: No such file or directory compilation terminated. I just thought I would throw in my own experience struggling with this problem to help whoever has enough C++ knowledge to make this work. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#2412 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAePJ_QWZyv8oHIq7r503GQuP0eovPemks5r89udgaJpZM4Ig4U3> .
body:
You must install Eigen and link to it properly.
I ran into a similar issue until I installed Eigen.

On Wed, May 24, 2017 at 3:26 AM Sean Aubin <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Despite the advice of @lababidi <https://github.com/lababidi>, the
> following command:
>
> g++ -std=c++11 -o tf_basic \
> -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/ \
> -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/bazel-genfiles/ \
> -I /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/third_party/ \
> -g -Wall -D_DEBUG -Wshadow -Wno-sign-compare -w \
> -L /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/bazel-bin/tensorflow/ \
> `pkg-config --cflags --libs protobuf` -l tensorflow_cc basic.cc
>
> To compile:
>
> #include <tensorflow/core/public/session.h>
> #include <tensorflow/core/platform/env.h>
>
> #include <iostream>
> #include <chrono>
> #include <fstream>
> #include <string>
> #include <vector>
> #include <sstream>
>
> using namespace std;
> using namespace chrono;
> using namespace tensorflow;
>
> int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
>
>   // Initialize a tensorflow session
>   cout << "start initalize session" << "\n";
>   Session* session;
>   Status status = NewSession(SessionOptions(), &session);
>   if (!status.ok()) {
>     cout << status.ToString() << "\n";
>     return 1;
>   }
> }
>
> But this gives me the error:
>
> In file included from /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/tensor.h:19:0,
>                  from /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/public/session.h:23,
>                  from basic.cc:1:
> /home/saubin/src/tensorflow/third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor:1:42: fatal error: unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor: No such file or directory
> compilation terminated.
>
> I just thought I would throw in my own experience struggling with this
> problem to help whoever has enough C++ knowledge to make this work.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/2412#issuecomment-303640207>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAePJ_QWZyv8oHIq7r503GQuP0eovPemks5r89udgaJpZM4Ig4U3>
> .
>
